handDesc.p: Halantas. Final M is fairly large, but highly simplified into a tick-mark shape. Anusvāra is normally placed above headline to the right of the character to which it belongs. It is occasionally to the right of the next character, which has been treated as a scribal error, while when it is right atop the next character, as in the toponym Uppolaṁbu in line 17 (and probably maṁgi in line 7), it has been read in the expected place. Other palaeographic observations. The script is a mature alphabet executed beautifully and very neatly.

projectDesc.p: The project DHARMA has received funding from the European Research Council (ERC) under the European Union's Horizon 2020 research and innovation programme (grant agreement no 809994).

prefixDef.p: Public URIs with the prefix bib to point to a Zotero Group Library named ERC-DHARMA whose data are open to the public.
Internal URIs using the part prefix to point to person elements in the DHARMA_IdListMembers_v01.xml file.

div.head: Plates
div.p:
P1020531.JPG; beneath ring: P1020533.JPG svasti+. śrīmata!āṁ sakala-bhu(va)[*na-saṁstūyamāna-mānavya-sagotrāṇāṁ = 13]
ha!āriti-putrāṇāṁ kauśi[k]ī-[*vara-prasāda-labdha-rājyānāṁ svāmi-mahāsena = 16, expecting 14, perhaps without vara as in 00093]
pa!ādāHOLEnudhya!āta!ānāṁ [*bhagavan-nārāyaṇa-prasāda-samāsādita-va = 16; expecting 16]
rā HOLE halācaṁ!ṁcha(n)e [kṣaṇa-kṣaṇa-vaśīkr̥tārāti-maṇḍalānām aśvame = 17; expecting 16]
dha!āvabhr̥tha-snāna-pavi(tr)[ī] [*kr̥ta-vapuṣāṁ calukyānāṁ kulam alaṁkari = 15; expecting 14]
ṣṇo+ḥ śrī-viṣ(ṇu)varddhana-maha!ā [rājasya sūnor … expecting 15]

-yuvarāja!āpara-nāma-dehaya!deyaḥ tat-priya-sūnu+ḥ Akaciṁgaṁgasāgara(?X)
dhya HOLE paripakaṁ tulādānādh!di-daśa-vidha-mahā-dāna-manā(th)ika
dāna-buddhi+ḥ Aneka-taṭākārāma-devālaya-pratiṣṭ!ṭhita-prabha!āva+ḥ sa
rvva-lokāśraya-śrī-viṣṇuvarddhana-maha!ārāja+ḥ gudrahāra-viṣaye pasapu(ba)
(ṟṟu-nā)ma grāmam adhivasato rāṣṭraku!ūṭa-pramukhān kuṭi!uṁbinas sarvva!ān it(th)a
P1020544.JPG; beneath ring: P1020547.JPG; line ends clearer in P1020543.JPG, P1020551.JPG m ājñ!apayati+. viditam astu vo +’smābhi+ḥ paṟantūr-vvāstavyāya sā(ṁ)kr̥ ARIE: Paṟandūr
ti-gotrāya prāvacana-sūtrāya ṣaḍ-aṁga-vi+de nārāyaṇa +śarmmaṇa+ ḫ pautrāya tri-vedi
-deHOLEvaśarmmaṇaḫ putrāya caturvvedi-keśavaśarmmaṇe Asya grā
maHOLEsya pūrvva-diśīṁ!āyāṁ kṣetrasya pūrvvataḥ śrīgaṁM!śr̥ṁgaM+. dakṣiṇataḥ Ervvoka-ce
nu+. paścimataḥ Uppolaṁbu+. Uttarataḥ veḷḷeṟu+. Evañ ca
tur-avadhi-madhya-st!thita pañcadaśa ceṇḍi-vri!īhi-v!bījāvā(pa)
P1020538.JPG; beneath ring: P1020541.JPG paripramāṇaṁ kṣetraM gr̥ha-st!thānañ ca puṣpa-vāṭik(ā-sa)
hi?taṁ sūrj!yya-grahaṇa-nimitte Udaka-pūrvvaṁ ¡kr̥tya! dattaM sarvva-kara-pariha!ā
reṇa HOLE na kha!kenacir bba!d bādhā karaṇīyā karoti yas sa {sa} pañca-mah(ā-pā)
takaHOLE-saṁyukto bhavati+. vyāsenāpy uktaṁ!ḥ ślokaḥ (sva)-dattā(ṁ) para-dattā(ṁ) vā
yo hareta vasundhā!arāṁ ṣaṣṭiṁ varṣa-sahasrāṇi viṣṭ!ṭha!āyā(ṁ) jāyate
kri!r̥mi+ḥ Ājṇaptir asya dharmmasya Agra-mahiṣ!i-vijaya-mahādev(ī)

Reported in 11A/1913-19149 with a description at 858. No previous edition known. The present edition by Dániel Balogh is based on photographs taken by myself in February 2023 at the Andhra Sahitya Parishad Museum, Kakinada, and on estampages preserved at the ASI, Mysore.The larger part of plate 3 has been lost since the plate was first recorded, so the text of fragment b is only available in the estampage, which only shows a small crack.
